subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(File source, File target) ?
msgSnippet: ... Diasparsoft Toolkit (www.diasparsoftware.com/toolkit) includes a StreamUtil class that reads and collects text from an InputStream. Then you could write
messageBody:
ianatyahoo@... wrote:

> Is there a
>
> boolean assertEquals( f1, f2 ) where the contents
>
> are compared and evaluated ?
> It's easy enough to write one but I'd rather reuse than
> re-invent.

Diasparsoft Toolkit (www.diasparsoftware.com/toolkit) includes a
StreamUtil class that reads and collects text from an InputStream. Then
you could write this:

assertEquals(
StreamUtil.getContentAsString(new FileInputStream(f1)),
StreamUtil.getContentAsString(new FileInputStream(f2)));

It's not quite drag-and-drop reuse, but it's easy to then extract this
to assertFileContentsEqual().

I recommend /against/ calling this method assertEquals(File, File),
because File objects are equal if they represent the same /file/, and
not the same contents. This is how File#equals() is already defined.

Take care.
